Taxon name.Name: Schizophyllum commune
Taxon name.Synonymy:
Current name: Schizophyllum commune Fries 1821 MB#208403 
Taxonomic synonyms: 
   - Agaricus alneus Linnaeus 1753 MB#207608 
         - Schizophyllum alneum (Linnaeus) Kuntze 1898 MB#121903 
         - Apus alneus (Linnaeus) Gray 1821 MB#486511 
         - Merulius alneus (Linnaeus) J.F. Gmelin 1792 MB#440085 
         - Schizophyllum alneus (Linnaeus) Kuntze 1898 MB#523460 
         - Scaphophorum agaricoides Ehrenberg 1820 MB#560945 
   - Schizonia vulgaris Persoon 1828 MB#432129 
   - Scaphophoeum agaricoides Ehrenberg 1820 MB#450725 
   - Merulius communis (Fries) Spirin & Zmitrovich 2004 MB#366358 
   - Daedalea commune (Fries) P. Kummer 1871 MB#507835

Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: no known restrictions under the Nagoya protocol
History: IHEM, 1990 < ATCC < M.G. Paice strain Delmar < L. Jurasek
Applications: produces: xylanase A (Appl. Environ. Microbiol. 36: 802-808, 1978), ferulic acid esterase (ibid., 54: 1170-1173, 1988), cellulase, ß-glucosidase and xylanase (Dev. Ind. Microbiol. 22: 675-684, 1981), endo-ß-1,4- glucanases (Bio/ Technology  2: 535-539, 1984), 1,4 ß-D-glucanases (J. Bacteriol. 159: 294-299, 1984), esterases and xylanases (Bio/ Technology 4: 731-733, 1986) and endo-1,4-ß-D-xylanase (Biochem. J. 270: 91-96, 1990); sceleroglucans (J. Ind. Microbiol. 9: 19-25, 1992); ß-1,3-/ß-1,6-glucan (Exp. Mycol. 16: 197-206, 1992; J. Biotechnol. 27: 193-201,1993; DECHEMA Biotechnol. Conf. 5: 569-572, 1992); and extracellular neutral polysaccharide (Bioprocess Eng. 6: 179-186, 1991); high production of ß-glucosidase (ibid., 41: 222-228, 1981); induction of cellulase with thiocellobiose (J. Bacteriol. 149: 47-53, 1982); Tyrosyl residues in substrate binding sites (Biochemistry 34: 2006-2014, 1995)
